concise_definition: adj. 黄色的, 黄的; n. 黄色; v. 变黄

definitions.explanation_en: Of, relating to, or having the color of the part of the visible spectrum between green and orange, typically associated with sunshine, lemons, or gold.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指可见光谱中位于绿色与橙色之间的颜色，通常与阳光、柠檬或黄金相关联。
definitions.example_en: The children painted the sun bright yellow in their artwork.
definitions.example_cn: 孩子们在画中把太阳涂成了明亮的黄色。

definitions.explanation_en: The color between green and orange in the visible spectrum; also used to refer to things of this color.
definitions.explanation_cn: 可见光谱中位于绿色与橙色之间的颜色；也可泛指具有这种颜色的事物。
definitions.example_en: She wore a stunning yellow dress to the party.
definitions.example_cn: 她穿了一条令人惊艳的黄色连衣裙去参加派对。

definitions.explanation_en: To become yellow in color, especially due to age, decay, or exposure to the elements.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因老化、腐烂或暴露于自然环境中而变黄。
definitions.example_en: The old pages of the book had yellowed over time.
definitions.example_cn: 这本书的旧书页随着时间的推移已经泛黄。

definitions.explanation_en: Used figuratively to describe someone who is cowardly or lacking courage, especially in American slang.
definitions.explanation_cn: 比喻用法，形容人胆小、缺乏勇气（尤用于美式俚语）。
definitions.example_en: He was called yellow for refusing to stand up to the bully.
definitions.example_cn: 他因为不敢对抗欺凌者而被骂胆小鬼。

comparison.analysis: “Amber”（琥珀色）是一种偏红或偏橙的深黄色，常用于描述宝石、树脂或黄昏时的光线，带有温暖、浓郁的质感。而 “yellow” 是更基础、更中性的颜色名称，涵盖从浅黄到深黄的广泛色域，不带有特定色调倾向。
“Gold”（金色）通常指带有金属光泽的明亮黄色，常与财富、奢华或神圣性相关联，具有反射性和光泽感。而 “yellow” 是纯粹的颜色描述，不隐含材质或价值含义，更偏向视觉属性。
“Ochre”（赭石色）是一种天然土黄色，偏棕或偏红，常见于自然地貌和古典绘画颜料，具有质朴、沉稳的视觉效果。相比之下，”yellow“ 更通用、更明亮，常用于现代语境，而 ochre 更具艺术和地质语境的特殊性。
